item.title: Recurse Center Day 27: Errlang
item.description:
Previously – link to my old post

Introduction

the syntax of Rust and Go

Steps

  1. Add a new token
  2. Update the parser
  3. Update the CST/AST

Parsing

There are no tests :| and docs are old :|

  1. Figure out what is the func declaration is called
  2. Add an optional Try operator

I wanted

Goland

Set up GOROOT to local!

Line numbers all changed!

item.title: Recurse Center Day 24: Hacking Go compiler to add a new keyword
item.description: I forked and modified Go compiler to add a new keyword called let, as alias for var

item.title: Recurse Center Day 23: Reflections
item.description:
Week 6 is started yesterday and that’s half time of RC is done. Stopped working on the database project entirely. Once I understood the internals, the B Tree algorithms and file formats, I lost the motivation to code. I think my driving factor was the unknowns of the building blocks. I will continue to watch lectures and continue learning more.

Reflections

  • Pairing
  • What makes RC pru people and how RC helps
  • Have many project ideas

I added a new token in syntax/tokens.go. Next step was to generate tokens by using go generate in syntax directory but I got an error:

item.title: Recurse Center Day 2: BTree Node
item.description:
This is a draft post that I have prematurely published. Currently, I am attending RC and I want to write as much as possible, log my daily learnings and activities. But, I also don't want to spend time on grammar and prose, so I am publishing all the posts which usually I'd have kept in my draft folder.

B Tree

I started working on the B Tree project, created a Github repo, put up skeleton code. Then I started wondering how best would I represent a B Tree node in code.

item.title: Recurse Center Day 1: init
item.description:
This is a draft post that I have prematurely published. Currently, I am attending RC and I want to write as much as possible, log my daily learnings and activities. But, I also don't want to spend time on grammar and prose, so I am publishing all the posts which usually I'd have kept in my draft folder.

My RC first day was filled with welcome events and fun activities. It was nice to meet all the lovely people.
